results.title: We grew a frog
results.creator_credit: Boulton-Hawker Films, Peter Boulton and Nigel Rea
results.brief_description:
Records an activity in which children collect and rear frog spawn in a tank at their school. Covers each stage in the development of the frog, showing details not easily seen in a classroom aquarium.
Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: We found a valley
results.brief_description: An account of the building of a large oil refinery on a strip of sand near Aden in Arabia. Shows the difficulties and local hazards encountered in this engineering achievement.

results.title: We don't want to live on our knees
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International and Julia Spark
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “History in action”.
On 2nd August 1968, Soviet planes and tanks invaded Czechoslovakia. The invasion came as a surprise because only two weeks before a meeting at Bratislava between Dubcek, Secretary of the Czech Communist Party and the entire Russian Politbureau appeared to have gone well. Why then was Czechoslovakia invaded, and why did the Russians fear the new freedoms which had taken place?

results.title: We don't make him special
results.creator_credit: I E A, Marjorie Fisher, Joan Reidy and Peter Brighton
results.brief_description: The story of the integration into life’s normal activities of a Down’s syndrome child as related by his mother. The acceptance of the child into the school community is effectively portrayed enabling the program to be utilised by a school contemplating the integration of disabled students. A positive program that supports the belief that the whole community benefits from the integration of disabled people into society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: I E A, Marjorie Fisher, Joan Reidy and Peter Brighton

results.title: We discovered North Norway
results.brief_description: A train trip in the land of the midnight sun, through more than 500 tunnels. Per Host shows the grandeur of Northern Norway, which until recently very few Norwegians had ever seen. It is a geographical anomaly that here, north of the arctic circle, one can sun-bathe and swim in the fjords amid the towering peaks and plunging ravines.

results.title: We did it!: Western Australia
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee, Elisabeth Knight and Keith Gow
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On the job (A)”.
Shows Aboriginal people in Western Australia talking about how they got their jobs, what they like about them and giving tips for other job seekers. Includes a student enrolled nurse, a teacher’s aide, a beautician, a horticulturalist and a park ranger.
Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

Episode of Series “On the job (A)”.
Shows Aboriginal people in Victoria talking about how they got their jobs, what they like about them and giving tips for other job seekers. Includes an apprentice chef, an apprentice painter and decorator, an apprentice gardener and a library assistant.
Suitable fvor middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: We did it!: South Australia
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee, Elisabeth Knight and Keith Gow
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On the job (A)”.
Shows Aboriginal people at work in South Australia, talking about how they got their jobs, what they like about them and giving tips for other job seekers. Includes a fisheries officer, an apprentice diesel mechanic, a nurse, a carpenter and a teacher.
Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: We did it!: Rockhampton and Mackay
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee, Elisabeth Knight and Keith Gow
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On the job (A)”
Shows Aboriginal people at work in Rockhampton and Mackay, talking about how they got their jobs, what they like about them and giving tips for other job seekers. Includes an employment officer, a secretary, an apprentice picutre framer and a TAFE field officer.
Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
